Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: 2015: Guest Editor, Discrete Dynamics in Nature and Society (DEMNS). Special issue entitled: Time Delayed Equations as Models in Nature and Society.
2016: Guest Editor, Macroeconomic Dynamics. Special issue entitled: New tools for global analysis of economic dynamics

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: 1. Second FIMA International Conference Energy and Environment: new challenges to mathematical modelling and applications, Ayas-Champoluc, Aosta Valley (Italy), January 21-24, 2008. Paper presented: Labour supply in a polluted world.
2. Amases, National Conference, Trento, 2008 Monday 01 September 2008 - Thursday 04 September 2008 Paper Presented: Evolutionary dynamics of crime.

3. MDEF (Modelli Dinamici in Economia e Finanza, Urbino, 2008, September, 25-26-27. Paper Presented: Bifurcations and Chaotic Attractors in an Overlapping Generations Model with Negative Environmental Externalities.

4. International conference on formation and evolution of social and economic networks Paris, 2009, 25-27 June. Paper Presented: Will growth and technology destroy social interaction? The inverted U-shape hypothesis.

5. Amases, National Conference, Parma, 01 September 2009 - Friday 04 September 2009 . Paper Presented: Strategic interactions and heterogeneity in a overlapping generations model with negative environmental externalities.

7. 11th Workshop on Optimal Control, Dynamic Games and Nonlinear Dynamics, May 31st–June 2nd 2010, University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Paper Presented: Strategic interactions and heterogeneity in a overlapping generations model with negative environmental externalities.

6. Net 2010, Network, Topology and Dynamics, Milano, 2010, June 14-16, . Papers Presented: Local interactions in networks; Dynamics of SIR epidemic networks and simple demographic processes: a simulative approach with R; See you on Facebook: how time pressure and social networking are going to change human interactions.

8. Sixth Workshop MDEF 2010, Modelli Dinamici in Economia e Finanza, September 23th–25th, 2010, University of Urbino, Italy. Paper Presented: Local and global dynamics of an overlapping generations model with endogenous time discounting.
9. International Conference on Nonlinear Economic Dynamics (NED 2011), June 1st–3rd, 2011, Cartagena, Spain. Paper Presented: Non-linear dynamics in an OLG model with relational goods.
Organizzazione convegno AMASES 35th National Conference, September 15th–17th, 2011, University of Pisa, Italy.

20. AMASES 35th National Conference, September 15th–17th, 2011, University of Pisa, Italy. Paper Presented: “Nonlinear dynamics in an OLG growth model with young and old age labour supply: the role of public health expenditure”.

10. 12th Viennese Workshop on Optimal Control, Dynamic Games and Nonlinear Dynamics, May 30th–June 2nd, 2012, Vienna University of Technology, Vienna, Austria. Paper Presented: Nonlinear dynamics in a Cournot duopoly with relative profit delegation.
12. World Congress of IFNA Athens, June 25-1 July, 2012. Paper Presented: An overlapping Generations Model with Environment.

11. Seventh Workshop MDEF 2012 , Modelli Dinamici in Economia e Finanza”, September 20th–22nd, 2012, Department of Economics and Quantitative Methods, University of Urbino, Italy. Paper Presented: “Stability and Hopf bifurcation for a modified Solow-Swan growth model”.

13. 8th International Conference on Nonlinear Economic Dynamics (NED 2013), July 4th–6th, 2013, University of Siena, Siena, Italy, Paper presented “Endogenous labor supply, endogenous lifetime and economic growth: local and global indeterminacy”.
14. Amases National Conference 2013, Stresa, Thursday 05 September 2013 - Saturday 07 September 2013 ,Paper Presented: “Chaotic economic dynamics in an overlapping generations with environment”.
15. Amases National Conference 2014, Reggio Calabria, Thursday 04 September 2014 - Saturday 06 September 2014 Paper Presented: “A nonlinear Cournot duopoly with advertising”.

16. Eighth Workshop MDEF 2014 , Modelli Dinamici in Economia e Finanza”, September 18-20, Urbino, Italy, 2014, Department of Economics and Quantitative Methods, University of Urbino, Italy. Paper Presented: “A continuous time Cournot duopoly with delays”.
17. 9th NED 2015, June 25th–27th, 2015, Chuo University, Tokyo, Japan, Paper presented: “A characterisation of duopoly dynamics with frictions in production adjustments”
18. 9th MDEF 2016, June 23rd–25th, 2016, University of Urbino, Italy Paper Presented “ Disequilibrium dynamics in a keynesian model with time delays”
19. AMASES 40th National Conference, September 15th–17th, 2016, University of Catania, Italy. Paper Presented: “A contribution to the theory of fertility and economic development”
21. 10th NED 2017, September 7th–9th, 2017, University of Pisa. Organizzazione convegno.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Destinatari dell'incentivo una tantum anno 2012 per la produttività scientifica dato da UNIPI

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: 2007-2010: Course: "Theory of Growth and Economic Dynamics", Doctoral Programme in Mathematics for Economic Analysis, University of Pisa. (ogni anno corso di 20 ore)
Membro del collegio dei docenti del dottorato in "Matematica per le decisioni economiche"
2009: Course "Mathematical methods for Economic Analysis," Phd program Economics, Markets and Institutions, EMI - XXIV Cycle - I TERM - A.Y. 2008/2009 (IMT, Lucca) (corso di 20 ore)
2009: Course "Recursive Methods", International Doctoral Programme in Economics, Sant'Anna, Pisa. (20 ore)
2013-2016: Course Dynamics and Static and Dynamic Optimization, International Doctoral Programme in Economics, Sant'Anna, Pisa. (corso ogni anno di 32 ore)

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Referee per le seguenti riviste: Chaos Solitons and Fractals; Journal of Macroeconomic Dynamics; Journal of Economic Behavior and Organizations; Nonlinear Analysis (Modelling and control); Macroeconomic Dynamics; Economic Modelling; Abstract and Applied analysis; Computational Economics; Applied Mathematics and Computation; Mathematics and Computers in Simulation; Japanese Economic Review; Mathematical Social Science; Discrete Dynamics in Nature and Society, Physica A, Frontiers, Water Management, Entropy , Communications in nonlinear science and numerical simulation,
Supervisore di tesi di dottorato nell'ambito del dottorato di matematica per le decisioni economiche dell'Università di Pisa. Candidato: Delio Panaro.
Supervisore di tesi di dottorato nell'ambito del dottorato in metodi quantitativi per la politica economica dell'Università di Macerata. Candidato: Andrea Caravaggio.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: 2011 – 2013: Research Group Member (PRIN 2009) “Local interactions and global dynamics in economics and finance: models and tools ”. Director: Prof. Laura Gardini (University of Urbino).
